page.title: 06Tourist Attractions.
page.content: Bodrhyddan Hall is a 17th century house.In the garden is a sundial built in 1637 and a family monument originally erected in Rhyl in 1862.The main rooms open to the public are the Front and Main Halls,the White Drawing Room and the Big Dining Room.An Egyptian Mummy,over 2,000 years old,is the main attraction. Dyserth Waterfall is one of the "Seven Wonders of Wales"and is 13m.in height.In earlier times it was believed to have healing powers and was visited by pilgrims from all over the country. The Jesse Window in the Parish Church was taken from Basingwerk Abbey and it portrays the life of Jesus.The remains of two standing stones, possibly Celtic Crosses,are also found inside the church.
